result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Wilmer Antonio Rivera Ruiz

records.addlTxt: Returnable to any Jefferson County Judge.

[ml] Case called at 10:19am
Defendant Wilmer Antonio Rivera Ruiz DOES NOT appear. ADA Michael Witt appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Spanish Interpreter Shawna Stevenoski appears in court.

The Court notes the Defendant's non-appearance.
On Motion of the State, the Court authorizes and issues a Bench Warrant, Body Warrant, returnable to any Jefferson County Judge.

The Court finds the previously signed bond to be in default.

recess 10:21am
Letter to Clerk of Courts re: Billable Hours
Entry made in error - ML
Status conference on August 26, 2022 at 10:00 am.

[ma] Case called at 10:42 AM 
Defendant Wilmer Antonio Rivera Ruiz in court with Attorney Karl E Huebner.   Michael Witt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Shawna Stevenoski sworn as Spanish Interpreter for the Defendant.

The Court reviews the court record. 
Atty Huebner requests to withdraw from this case, and have a spanish speaking attorney be appointed, to avoid Defendant having to be billed for an interpreter. Atty Huebner notes that Atty Dahnert would not be able to take appointment due to a conflict. 

The Court grants Atty Huebner's request to withdraw. 

The Court directs a spanish speaking attorney be appointed.
recess: 10:54am 
NEXT: (1)Appoint Sucessor Counsel--Spanish Speaking[Dahnert has conflict] (2)Status of Counsel on 8/26/22 at 10:00am

to Surety - per 4/18/22 court order. 22C 014049
No updated address information - unable to forward.  (04/29) ML

Attorney Huebner

[ma] Case called at 3:12 PM [Court Reporter: Rose Roderick]
Defendant Wilmer Antonio Rivera Ruiz not in court.  DA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Sylvie Dahnert present to serve as Spanish Interpreter for Defendant 

The Court reviews court record.
DA Hall requests warrant.

The Court authorizes a $250 bench warrant, finds bond in default. 

recess: 3:15pm--reconvene: 3:20pm 
Defendant Wilmer Antonio Rivera Ruiz appears.  DA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Sylvie Dahnert sworn as Spanish Interpreter for Defendant 

The Court vacates previous orders re: bond and warrant 

[The Court conducts idigency examination of Mr. Rivera]
The Court appoints counsel for Mr. Rivera at the rate of $50/month beginning 6/1/22 and on/around 1st of every month thereafter. 

recess: 3:35pm

Defendant at COC counter with paperwork for case; directed to DAs office for pretrial conference(observed Defendant in DAs office lobby while I was in the hallway for an unrelated matter)//ma
(Note added in response to the DA's email request to have this case added to the Intake calendar based on the Defendant's failure to appear for PTC.)
No updated address information - unable to forward.  (03/14) ML
Scheduling Order
State Public Defender Determination of Financial Eligibility - Defendant not eligible.
Defendant obtained English/Spanish Petition for Appointment of Counsel form and Notice of Hearing from Clerk of Courts Office --ma

Pre-trial conference on March 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on April 18, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

[ma] Case called at 2:05pm 
Defendant Wilmer Antonio Rivera Ruiz appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, along with Public Defender Cassi Nelson (PD appears for bond-purposes only).  Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin. 

Patrick Ryan sworn as Spanish Interpreter

Right to Attorney given 

The Defendant updates address to 12'7' Nancy Lane; additionally indicates that his date of birth is July 10, 1991
State is to file an Amended Complaint

Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited.
Pleas of "Not Guilty" are entered; speedy trial is waived by the Defendant.


The Court reinstates signature bond as previously set. 

The Court finds probable cause on criminal complaint
recess 2:17 pm. 

NEXT: (1) Pretrial Conference on 3/16/22 at 8:30am   (2) Status Conference on 4/18/22 at 3:00pm

[ae] case called 08:48 AM Defendant Wilmer Antonio Rivera Ruiz not in court. ADA Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
The State requests that a probable cause warrant be issued. Upon review of the file the Court finds probable cause and issues warrant body only.  
Recess 08:53 AM

Copy of Minutes from 22GF201
[ml] The Matter of Wilmer Antonio Rivera Ruiz started at 2:05PM
The Defendant Wilmer Rivera Ruiz appears in court, without counsel. ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Spanish Interpreter Shawna Stevenoski appears by phone. The Court advises Ms. Stevenoski that she remains under oath.
This hearing was scheduled for a Bail Bond Hearing, however the State provides a copy of the Criminal Compliant to the Court. Due to a miscommunication, the Criminal case number (22CM8) was never called. The Court declines to proceed with an Intake Hearing as the Defendant has not had the Complaint read to him in Spanish. The Court instead sets bond, tolls any pending time limits, preserves the Defendant's objections, and sets this matter for an Initial Appearance at a later date.

The Court requires a $5,000.00 Signature Bond with special conditions:
--no discussion of the facts of the case with Victim 1
--maintain absolute sobriety
--no acts or threats of violence

recess 2:25PM

NEXT: Initial Appearance on 02/14/2022 at 8:30AM with in person appearances
Right to Legal Representation in a Criminal or Criminal Traffic Case
